meanings.definition: Absorbent material used for cleaning or washing.
meanings.sent1: I used a spongeing to clean the dishes.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen sink was full of different spongeings for cleaning.
meanings.sent3: The spongeing in the bathroom started a dance party with the soap.
meanings.sent4: The spongeing in the bucket eagerly awaited its turn to scrub the floor.
meanings.sent5: The colorful spongeing in the cleaning aisle caught my eye immediately.

meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a sponge.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys spongeing the car on weekends.
meanings.sent2: I will spongeing the spill on the table right away.
meanings.sent3: He was caught spongeing the whiteboard during class.
meanings.sent4: The rain was spongeing the ground, leaving puddles everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The chef was spongeing the countertop to keep it spotless.

meanings.definition: To take advantage of someone by constantly borrowing or asking for things.
meanings.sent1: He kept spongeing off his friends for money.
meanings.sent2: She was always spongeing things from her siblings.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be spongeing off the dog's treats.
meanings.sent4: The lazy roommate was spongeing off others for meals.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor was spongeing off our Wi-Fi without asking.

meanings.definition: To soak up or absorb liquid.
meanings.sent1: The spongeing quickly absorbed the spilled milk.
meanings.sent2: The dry spongeing began spongeing up the water on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The spongeing in the sink seemed to be spongeing up all the water.
meanings.sent4: The spongeing on the beach was spongeing up the ocean water.
meanings.sent5: The spongeing in the experiment was spongeing up the colored liquid.
